EPN- EDUCATION POST NEWS
        
              
          𝗜𝗜𝗧 𝗠𝗮𝗻𝗱𝗶 𝗶𝗻𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗱𝘂𝗰𝗲𝘀 𝘁𝘄𝗼 𝗻𝗲𝘄 𝗰𝗼𝘂𝗿𝘀𝗲𝘀 𝗶𝗻 𝗠𝘂𝘀𝗶𝗰 & 𝗠𝘂𝘀𝗼𝗽𝗮𝘁𝗵𝘆

The research-based M.S. and PhD programs in Musopathy and Music are designed to produce highly qualified professionals and scholars who can make significant contributions to the growth and understanding of music.

𝘊𝘭𝘪𝘤𝘬 𝘩𝘦𝘳𝘦 𝘵𝘰 𝘳𝘦𝘢𝘥 𝘮𝘰𝘳𝘦 👉 https://lnkd.in/gafbwWQn

#IITMandi #MusicEducation #Musopathy #NewCourses #AcademicInnovation #ResearchInMusic #HigherEducation #MusicStudies #AdvancedDegrees #EPNews

Wu Tsai Neurosciences Institute
        
              
          Stanford scientists (Corey Keller, Jessica Ross) are developing transcranial magnetic stimulation (TMS) methods that optimize neuromodulation effects using music-induced brain state dynamics. Their Koret Pilot Grant award will support a study tracking the effects of a novel sensory-entrained TMS protocol on excitability and plasticity in motor and prefrontal brain networks, with implications for personalized neuromodulation and clinical TMS.

The Koret Human Neurosciences Community Lab provides state-of-the-art EEG and TMS technologies alongside expert guidance to researchers across disciplines, promoting innovative research and collaboration. The goal of the Koret Pilot Grants is to increase accessibility of these advanced technologies to scientists of all disciplines and career levels.

Learn more about this project here: https://lnkd.in/d6gc9zkH

#stanford #research #neuroscience

Stanford Institute for Human-Centered Artificial Intelligence (HAI)
        
              
          Imagine an AI agent leading a team of AI scientist agents to tackle challenging, open-ended research, with a human researcher providing high-level feedback. According to Stanford HAI faculty affiliate James Zou, that’s where we’re headed. Read more: https://lnkd.in/geTSQQ5Z

aLL-i news
        
              
          This is a fascinating glimpse into the future of AI research! James Zou paints a picture of a truly collaborative and potentially revolutionary approach to scientific discovery. Here's a breakdown of why this idea is so compelling:
AI-led Scientific Teams:
Accelerated Discovery: Imagine AI agents capable of sifting through massive datasets, designing experiments, and analyzing results at speeds far beyond human capability. This could drastically accelerate the pace of research in fields like medicine, materials science, and climate science.
Novel Insights: AI agents might identify patterns and connections that human researchers could miss, leading to breakthroughs in understanding complex phenomena. Their ability to explore unconventional approaches could open up entirely new avenues of inquiry.
Increased Efficiency: By automating many of the tedious tasks involved in research, AI agents could free up human scientists to focus on higher-level thinking, creative problem-solving, and the "big picture" implications of their work.
Human-in-the-Loop:
Guidance and Ethics: While AI agents take on more responsibility, human researchers would still provide essential guidance, ensuring that research aligns with ethical considerations and societal values.
Intuition and Creativity: Human researchers bring unique qualities to the table, such as intuition, creativity, and the ability to connect seemingly disparate ideas. These remain crucial for framing research questions and interpreting results in a meaningful way.
Collaboration and Mentorship: The vision of an AI agent "leading" a team doesn't negate the role of human scientists. Instead, it suggests a collaborative partnership where humans mentor and guide AI agents, fostering their development and ensuring responsible use.
Potential Challenges:
Explainability and Trust: It's essential to develop AI agents that can explain their reasoning and decision-making processes, building trust and understanding between humans and AI.
Bias and Fairness: AI agents must be trained on diverse and unbiased datasets to avoid perpetuating existing societal biases in their research.
Control and Oversight: Clear mechanisms for human oversight and control are crucial to ensure that AI-driven research remains aligned with human values and goals.

Flanders Investment & Trade - USA
        
              
          🌟 Exciting advancements at Stanford University!

Dr. Olivier Gevaert and his team have developed Sequoia, an AI-powered tool revolutionizing cancer treatment by analyzing tumor biopsies to predict gene activity. This breakthrough:
🧬 Identifies optimal treatments like chemotherapy or immunotherapy.
📊 Boasts over 80% predictive accuracy for patient outcomes.
💡 Reduces costs by minimizing reliance on genomic tests.

Next steps? Clinical trials and FDA approval! Sequoia could transform oncology and beyond. 👏Congratulations to this team for shaping the future of medtech!

Interested to learn more? 📺Watch the news report here: https://lnkd.in/dgijRjxD

#Innovation #AIinHealthcare #CancerResearch #flemish

UCL Computer Science
        
              
          
MILISMA's ability to accurately detect red blood cell changes at scale will greatly enhance our ability to early detect those children progressing towards this severe malaria syndrome. " - Professor Delmiro Fernandez-Reyes

"Our deep learning model, MILISMA, not only improves the accuracy of SMA diagnosis but also provides a valuable tool for understanding the underlying pathology of the disease. This innovation could pave the way for studies that explore effective treatments and interventions." - Dr Petru Manescu 

UCL and University of Ibadan researchers have created an AI-driven model to detect severe malarial anaemia early, aiming to reduce child mortality in sub-Saharan Africa. 

https://lnkd.in/gQQqsZxe

#EarlyDetection #HealthcareInnovation #ChildHealth

QuEra Computing Inc.
        
              
          Thanks to coherent atomic shuttling, the exploration space for optimal algorithm compilation in neutral-atom quantum computers remains a promising area of innovation. In this work, a UCLA-based team led by Jason Cong continues to enhance their compilation stack, introducing processes to minimize data movement between zones (boosting speed and fidelity), increase the flexibility of zone architecture, and improve scheduling strategies. The advantages of zone-based architectures over monolithic processing systems are further validated, with the compiler predicting fidelity improvements exceeding a factor of 20 in benchmarking tests.

Read the full paper on arXiv! https://hubs.ly/Q02_Hm8D0

Irvine Sensors Corporation
        
              
          🧠🤖 𝗕𝗿𝗶𝗱𝗴𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗕𝗿𝗮𝗶𝗻 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗠𝗮𝗰𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗲

This recent Nature Magazine article illuminates the extraordinary complexity of the human brain—hosting roughly 86 billion neurons, each connecting with at least 10,000 synapses. These intricate neural connections inspire Irvine Sensors’ analog AI chipsets, designed to mimic biological efficiency and adaptability with groundbreaking results. By modeling our hardware on the brain’s neural structures, we aim to advance neuro-sensor technology and push the limits of real-time AI, autonomous systems, defense, and more.

#ArtificialIntelligence #Neuroscience #Innovation #AI #BrainInABoxFor20Watts

Artificial Intelligence Feed
        
              
          Unveiling Schrdingers Memory: Dynamic Memory Mechanisms in Transformer-Based Language Models

LLMs exhibit remarkable language abilities, prompting questions about their memory mechanisms. Unlike humans, who use memory for daily tasks, LLMs’ “memory” is derived from input rather than stored externally. Research efforts have aimed to improve ...

https://lnkd.in/edTjfdiD


#AI #ML #Automation

Science Featured
        
              
          Exploring the Invisible Forces of Angular-Momentum Waves in Physics - https://scft.link/uW3w5

Professor Jing-Ling Chen, Xing-Yan Fan, and Xiang-Ru Xie from Nankai University have discovered angular-momentum waves, potentially revolutionizing our understanding of particle physics. 

Their study was published in the journal Results in Physics. These waves, derived from the Yang-Mills equations, suggest new insights into the fundamental forces of nature and potential technological advancements.

#angularmomentum #particlephysics #YangMills #physicsresearch #sciencefeatured #sciencenews

Toshiba Quantum Technology
        
              
          Researchers discovered that bismuth atoms embedded in calcium oxide can function as qubits for quantum computers, providing a low-noise, durable, and inexpensive alternative to current materials.

Through using theoretical and computational approaches, scientists have discovered how tiny, lone atoms of bismuth embedded within solid calcium oxide can act as qubits, becoming the foundation for quantum computers and quantum communication devices.

Find out how this groundbreaking discovery could have the potential to transform quantum computing and telecommunications: https://lnkd.in/eJc6P-vz via SciTechDaily

#QuantumComputing #Technology #Science #Qubits

HumemAI
        
              
          Introducing HumemAI: A Machine With Human-Like Memory Systems!

Current AI systems lack memory. The HumemAI project, launched from Taewoon Kim’s PhD research, models memory with a knowledge graph to enable AI to remember and learn from past interactions.

https://humem.ai

Also check out our introduction video: https://lnkd.in/epb_m-vy

THE DECODER - EVERYTHING AI
        
              
          👉 The million-dollar ARC Prize is intended to encourage the development of AI that can adapt to new situations and solve simple reasoning tasks, and to steer research back toward general artificial intelligence (AGI).

👉 According to the researchers behind the prize, today's AI systems, like large language models, memorize patterns from human-generated data and reach their limits when new elements are introduced. Intelligence, however, is characterized by its ability to adapt to novelty.

👉 The ARC Prize builds on the ARC benchmark, which will be published in 2019, and aims to shift the focus from developing systems that outperform humans in individual tasks to AI systems with human-like cognitive abilities.

👇 Read more #ai #artificialintelligence

Towards Data Science
        
              
          Could reinforcement learning help validate AI-generated ideas in biology? The answer might just be yes. Meghan Heintz explores how RL is being applied in self-driving cars and autonomous labs.

xCures
        
              
          Deep learning is transforming osteoporosis risk prediction!

A recent study by Tulane University demonstrated that a deep neural network (DNN) outperforms traditional models, achieving an AUC of 0.848. The AUC, or Area Under the Curve, measures the ability of a model to distinguish between classes. An AUC of 0.848 is considered excellent, indicating high accuracy.

This tool analyzes demographic and clinical data, including age, weight, and grip strength, to identify at-risk individuals more accurately.

Early detection is crucial for preventing fractures and disabilities in older adults. The potential of AI in healthcare continues to grow, offering new avenues for precision medicine.

See link to original article in the comments below 👇

#AIinHealthcare #DeepLearning #PrecisionMedicine #Osteoporosis
